perturbation.original_text: 5.01.  Products Warranty. Company warrants that Distributor shall acquire Products purchased hereunder free and clear of all liens and encumbrances except for Company's purchase money security interest defined in Section 1.03, above. Company further warrants all Products to be free from defects in material or workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of delivery. Any defects must be replaced by the Company within sixty (60) days within this scope of the warranty and all charges for labor and material, will be borne by Company. If it is determined that either no fault exists in Company, or the damage was caused by negligence of Distributor, its agents, employees or customers, Distributor agrees to pay all charges associated with each such replacement. THIS CONSTITUTES THE SOLE WARRANTY MADE BY COMPANY EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED. THERE ARE NO OTHER WARRANTIES EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED WHICH EXTEND BEYOND THE FACE HEREOF, HEREIN, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. IN NO EVENT SHALL COMPANY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES AND DISTRIBUTOR'S REMEDIES SHALL BE LIMITED TO REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF NONCONFORMING UNITS OR PARTS.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.01.  Products Warranty. Company warrants that Distributor shall acquire Products purchased hereunder free and clear of all liens and encumbrances except for Company's purchase money security interest defined in Section 1.03, above. Company warrants all Products to be free from defects in material or workmanship under normal use and service, but the duration of this warranty is subject to change based on the Company's discretion and product performance. Any defects must be replaced by the Company within a reasonable time frame, as determined by Company's service department. If it is determined that either no fault exists in Company, or the damage was caused by negligence of Distributor, its agents, employees or customers, Distributor agrees to pay all charges associated with each such replacement. THIS CONSTITUTES THE SOLE WARRANTY MADE BY COMPANY EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED. THERE ARE NO OTHER WARRANTIES EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED WHICH EXTEND BEYOND THE FACE HEREOF, HEREIN, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. IN NO EVENT SHALL COMPANY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES AND DISTRIBUTOR'S REMEDIES SHALL BE LIMITED TO REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF NONCONFORMING UNITS OR PARTS.
perturbation.explanation: The original warranty clearly states a 90-day period. The modified warranty introduces uncertainty about the duration and the timeframe for replacements, making it unclear what the actual warranty terms are and contradicting the previously stated 90-day period. This creates potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 3.03.  Cancellation. Distributor may, at any time prior to the scheduled date of shipment, cancel any or all Products on order upon giving timely written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.03.  Cancellation. Distributor may cancel any or all Products on order; however, cancellation is subject to a cancellation fee equal to 10% of the total order value if the cancellation occurs within 72 hours of the scheduled shipment date. Company retains the right to deny cancellation if products are already en route to the Distributor. Any refunds from cancellation will be provided within 90 business days from date of request.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause allows for cancellation at any time before shipment. The modification introduces cancellation fees and restrictions, creating a contradiction on the conditions of cancellation, making it unclear under which circumstances cancellation is permitted without penalty.

perturbation.original_text: 1.01.  Distribution Right. The Company hereby appoints and grants Distributor the exclusive right to sell the products of the Company, including the Snotarator™ Nasal Aspirator,  ("Products") listed in the current "Price List" (Exhibit "A" attached hereto). The distribution right shall be limited to all countries and all of their territories and possessions within the continent known as South America ("Territory")  (Exhibit "B" attached hereto).  Distributor agrees that the Products, including the name Snotarator ™ Nasal Aspirator (the "Brand") are the sole property of the Company and Distributor has no interest whatsoever in such Brand and Products, and Distributor shall use the Brand and Products only for so long as the rights granted hereby remains in full force and effect.  Distributor shall not take any actions, or aid or assist any other party to take any actions that would infringe upon, harm or contest the proprietary rights of Company in and to the Brand and Products.  Distributor shall not assign the rights granted in this Section 1.01 without the prior written consent of the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.01. Distribution Right. The Company hereby appoints and grants Distributor a non-exclusive right to sell the products of the Company, including the Snotarator™ Nasal Aspirator, ("Products") listed in the current "Price List" (Exhibit "A" attached hereto). While the primary territory is South America ("Territory") (Exhibit "B" attached hereto), the Company reserves the right to appoint other distributors in the same Territory. Distributor agrees that the Products, including the name Snotarator ™ Nasal Aspirator (the "Brand") are the sole property of the Company and Distributor has no interest whatsoever in such Brand and Products, and Distributor shall use the Brand and Products only for so long as the rights granted hereby remains in full force and effect. Distributor shall not take any actions, or aid or assist any other party to take any actions that would infringe upon, harm or contest the proprietary rights of Company in and to the Brand and Products. Distributor shall not assign the rights granted in this Section 1.01 without the prior written consent of the Company.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause grants the Distributor an 'exclusive right' to sell the products in South America. The modified clause changes this to a 'non-exclusive right' and states that the company reserves the right to appoint other distributors in the same territory, creating a direct contradiction. This ambiguity would lead to disputes over sales rights and market competition.
